textbooks.Algorithms: Introduction to Algorithms - Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest, Stein
textbooks.Operating Systems: Modern Operating Systems - Andrew S. Tanenbaum
textbooks.Database: Fundamentals of Database Systems - Elmasri, Navathe
textbooks.Networks: Data Communications and Networking - Behrouz A. Forouzan

all.question: In dynamic programming, what is the optimal substructure property?
options: Optimal solution contains optimal solutions to subproblems
all.explanation: Optimal substructure means optimal solution is composed of optimal solutions to subproblems.

all.question: According to Cormen, what is the running time of Insertion Sort in the best case?
all.explanation: Best case occurs when array is already sorted, requiring only O(n) comparisons.

all.question: What is the difference between conflict serializability and view serializability?
all.explanation: Every conflict serializable schedule is view serializable, but not vice versa.

all.question: What is a primary key in relational databases?
all.explanation: Primary key uniquely identifies each tuple in a relation.

all.question: What does ACID stand for in database transactions?
all.explanation: ACID properties ensure reliable transaction processing.

all.question: What is the size of IPv4 address?
all.explanation: IPv4 uses 32-bit addresses, typically written as four octets.

all.question: In Fibonacci heap, what is the amortized cost of EXTRACT-MIN operation?
all.explanation: EXTRACT-MIN requires consolidating trees, giving O(log n) amortized time.

all.question: What is the efficiency of slotted ALOHA?
all.explanation: Slotted ALOHA has maximum efficiency of 1/e ≈ 36.8%.

all.question: For recurrence T(n) = T(n/3) + T(2n/3) + O(n), what is the solution using recursion tree method?
all.explanation: Height of tree is log₃/₂(n), each level does O(n) work, giving O(n log n).

all.question: What is a process in operating systems?
all.explanation: Process is an instance of a program in execution with its own address space.

all.question: In CSMA/CD, what is the minimum frame size for 10 Mbps Ethernet with 2.5 km max distance?
all.explanation: Minimum frame must be large enough to detect collisions: 64 bytes for 10 Mbps Ethernet.

all.question: What is the working set model in memory management?
options: Set of pages in last Δ references
all.explanation: Working set is set of pages referenced in last Δ memory references.

all.question: In divide-and-conquer paradigm, which step combines solutions of subproblems?
all.explanation: Combine step merges solutions of subproblems to solve original problem.

all.question: In distributed systems, what is the Byzantine Generals Problem about?
all.explanation: Byzantine Generals Problem deals with reaching consensus when some processes may be faulty or malicious.

all.question: In two-phase locking, when are locks released?
all.explanation: 2PL has growing phase (acquire locks) and shrinking phase (release locks).

all.question: In TCP congestion control, if ssthresh=32KB and cwnd=16KB, after timeout what is new ssthresh?
all.explanation: New ssthresh = cwnd/2 = 16KB/2 = 8KB after timeout.

all.question: A relation R(A,B,C) with FD: A→B, B→C. What is the highest normal form?
all.explanation: Transitive dependency B→C violates 3NF but satisfies 2NF.

all.question: In OSI model, which layer is responsible for end-to-end communication?
all.explanation: Transport layer provides end-to-end communication services.

all.question: In multilevel feedback queue scheduling, what happens when a process uses its entire time quantum?
all.explanation: Process is demoted to lower priority queue to favor I/O-bound processes.

all.question: According to Tanenbaum, what is the main purpose of an operating system?
all.explanation: OS provides abstraction of hardware resources to make them easier to use.
